message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SY

The paper deals with the multi-armed bandit problem, which is a classic problem in machine learning and optimization. The use of stochastic processes and regret analysis suggests that the paper belongs to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG). The use of algorithms and the focus on designing and analyzing them suggests that the paper also belongs to the sub-category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of tools for measuring non-stationarity and the focus on designing algorithms for non-stationary problems suggests that the paper also belongs to the sub-category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The use of information theory and the focus on deriving regret bounds suggests that the paper also belongs to the sub-category of information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the use of control theory and the focus on designing algorithms for dynamic systems suggests that the paper also belongs to the sub-category of systems and control (cs.SY).
